medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe epigastric pain radiating to the left upper quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began suddenly this morning at 1:00 AM. The pain was initially maximum severe and has now decreased to moderate. There has been mild improvement with stretching backwards. The patient has not experienced vomiting and has been passing gas. This episode is similar to one prior episode in the past.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Melanoma status post immunotherapy, stage 4 with 3 metastases, complications of uveitis and Addison's disease, undescended testicle, adenopathy, hilar, sarcoidosis, colonic polyps, elevated blood pressure, retinoschisis, bullous, hypertension, gastritis.
